rComments: Loved this professor. He assigns lots of reading. He will make you write at least one essay. His exam are essay format and most of the time he gives out the exam questions ahead of time and then only picks one two questions that you will have to write an essay for.   He is very nice outside of class, loves teaching, and  cares about students.

While Professor Schoenman is passionate and enthusiastic about the material, his lecturing style is quite dull, which is unfortunate given that he clearly loves what he's teaching. Lectures are an hour and 45 minutes of very detailed material that you are never tested on. I wouldn't recommend this course unless you're really into the topic.

My favorite professor this quarter. Very intelligent, very articulate and also, he's brings humor into lecture. Personally, I think International Political Economy is an interesting subject but I know some students may disagree with me. However, I think most students, including myself, can agree that his lectures are worth attending!

Prof. Shoenman is a really nice guy who's always willing to help, but his lectures tend to be a bit boring and he often forgets to give breaks for long class periods. The fact that he sounds exactly like Ira Glass makes it REAAALLY hard to stay awake too. But he's always well informed so if you like the subject he's teaching, you'll like him.

I loved him! He was very funny and I thought that he was a great lecturer. IPE is not the most exciting thing to learn about but he made it fun. The only thing that I didn't like is that we had to read so much. Often the readings were too dense so it felt like a waste to read them if I wasn't even going to understand them.
Attend lecture because he wont put anything useful online. He is a down to earth professor and can be easily reached. His classes are not dry but not exciting either. Careful, the TA you get matters.

Really nice guy but not my favourite lecturer. Tends to let people ask too many questions which aren't relevant to class topics. Easy if you have a good politics base otherwise be prepared to do lots of reading! Tip for midterms/finals, pick out key arguments made by authors and just make up some argument structured around it lol

Like a previous review, this class should be taken if you have an innate interest in the workings of global politics. The beginning is DRY and section is mandatory. Midterm and finals are essays in class and you are given the prompts beforehand and you must cite readings in the tests. Two quizzes too. Simple and to the point.

i recommend taking this class only if you have an innate interest in the world economy. the first section of the class will be very dry, but it will eventually become more interesting. be prepared for a lot of readings (150 pages a week) and a written final and midterm that requires a fair amount of studying. overall, a good class.

My second time through Schoenman. He is still a good professor. I still think he should post the slides on the web. Had a fun time. Enjoyed my way through his class mostly because I enjoy the subject. Schoenman seems like a nice class although I didn't get the chance to see him at office hours. The TA jeb was excellent and really made the classgood
Talks at 100 mph!
Schoenman is a good teacher. Cool friendly person. Clear lectures that actuallty teach. Only thing is he should post lecture notes on internet.

This class was very dry at the beginning, but got a lot better as the class went on.  The readings can be long and difficult at times, but if you're interested in the material it's not that bad.  Roger is a good professor and I learned a lot from him. If you're interested in the material, you'll like the class. I personally got a lot out of it.

Lectures were BRUTAL. Has a hard time flowing smoothly, pauses a LOT. Lot's of reading, midterm was essays, final was take-home (easy), a quiz or two. Take good notes & read on what he lectures & you should be ok. He knows his stuff, but it's very dry. He's also very nice & approachable. Get class slides before & take extra notes on them in class.

I had zero interest in econ upon entering this class, but Roger totally changed that. After the first few lectures on theory I thought the class would be really boring, but once theory is done he totally rocks your world with his knowledge, personality and teaching style. I totally loved this class in the end and was sad it had to end.

Lectures were difficult to follow, reading was far too difficult and time-consuming to teach the concepts he wanted to teach. He is helpful if you are struggling, and he also is fairly new to teaching, so in a few years he will likely be a fantastic professor.
Easily the best teacher I've had in 4 years at UCSC.  very clear, very easy to understand.  perfect pace for people who are not economy experts.  Always available to help.  Very funny and engaging.

I really liked this class. I believe Roger was a very fair person, and he does give out a lot of reading. If you are a politics major or just find these things interesting this is your class. If you are not really interested then I would be careful. By the way, be nice to the TAs, they grade everything.
he a very very good lecturer and made class entertaining. take a class with him it is def worht it

He is very clear and a fairly entertaining lecturer. The course is fairly easy (in class 2 essay midterm, debate, and two 3-5 page essays for the final). Make sure you site authors in exams. I enjoyed the class, although the 1st half of the course is econ theory which is taught in so many other politics classes too.

A lot of work, but a lot of fun. Really, the only problem with this class was the fact that everyone in the front row felt the need to ask ridiculous questions that only took up our time. He's a genuinely nice guy, knows his stuff, and I aced all the tests even though I didn't do much reading. Just attend the lectures, take notes, and stay awake.

I consider Roger the best instuctor I had at UCSC.  His lectures were well structured, clear and most importantly concise.  He delivered more or less prepared remarks from an outline, yet in a conversational tone perfectly paced for note taking.  The readings provided were excellent and engaging.  Also, just a great guy when it comes down to it.

Roger has a way of dismissing questions that makes not only the questioner feel stupid, but the entire class feels stupid, too. Don't dare wonder about anything other than the material of the lecture and only the lecture. I don't mind that he shuts down the idiotic closed minded leftists, though.
WOW SO MUCH READING!
No Comments

Definately not for slackers, but the professor was very helpful and approachable. The material was tough (economic based) but if students ask for an open note test, almost always agrees. Plus, he's totally hot (european style) and also had a hot TA!..:)

I've never known of a professor more helpful to a student as Roger was to me.  My writing has improved by a factor of four merely because of his office hours.  I hear that his course in Political Economy (176) is epic, but a lot of reading.
great professor, very helpful, and in addition handsome

Roger is a very knowledgeable professor in the field of the political economy.  He is very clear and is one of my favorite teachers at ucsc.  Real nice guy and helpful both in class and outside of class.
Great professor.  Really fun and well put together.  Challenging but definitely worth it.
